title: ADR Lifecycle Status
description: Lifecycle status for Architecture Decision Records (ADRs) and standards documents. Inspired by ThoughtWorks Technology Radar maturity model, adapted for architectural decision tracking.

statusDescriptions.proposal: Under evaluation, not yet accepted. Teams should review and provide feedback. Not for production use.
statusDescriptions.experimental: Approved for trial use. May change based on implementation feedback. Use with caution in non-critical paths.
statusDescriptions.accepted: Approved and recommended for active use. Implementation details are stable, but adoption is still growing.
statusDescriptions.stable: Widely adopted and battle-tested across multiple implementations. Recommended as best practice.
statusDescriptions.deprecated: Still valid but discouraged. Migration path to replacement available. Plan to migrate by documented deadline.
statusDescriptions.superseded: Replaced by another ADR. See 'superseded_by' field for replacement. Kept for historical reference.
statusDescriptions.retired: No longer relevant to current architecture. Kept for historical reference only.

sortOrder.description: Numeric sort order for lifecycle status. Lower numbers indicate earlier stages. Enables comparative operations (e.g., status >= accepted, filter active ADRs).

active.description: ADRs in active use (proposal through stable)

phasing-out.description: ADRs being phased out (deprecated through retired)

production-ready.description: ADRs safe for production use (accepted and stable)

$comment: Used in ADR frontmatter to track decision maturity and guide adoption. Maps to adoption tracking in helper libraries.
